Descriptions_WS_WA: Rich, classic wines; few poor bottle, some are tannic
many intesnse wines, but beware those caught in late-season rain
many elegant wines, but others reflect excessive yields
Extraordinary balance, pure flavors; some great wines
some great wines, but others are overripe
clear, pure flavors and excellent balance
Ripe flavors, but fruit character mostly fresh, not dried
Delicate wines; some can benefit from cellaring, others weak
Perfect balance of light textures and rich, vivid flavors
Best have real ripeness and depth, with modest alcohol
Light, bordering on fragile; tantalizing if flavorful enough

Early and warm vintage with pockets of cool weather in summer, lending balance and elegance
A cold, rainy spring and hot, dry summer led to potentially angular wines, but quality in generally high
Mid-september showers revived vines stressed by a warm, arid summer, laying the groundwork for excellent wines
